perturbation.original_text: 2.15. Developer acknowledges that time is of the essence in this Agreement. If Developer has not obtained approval and entered into a binding lease or purchase agreement for each site for El Pollo Loco® Restaurant(s) to be developed under this Agreement by the applicable Site Commitment Date, Developer shall be in default of its obligations under the Development Schedule and Franchisor shall be entitled to exercise its rights and remedies under this Agreement, up to and including termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.15. Developer acknowledges that time is of the essence in this Agreement. If Developer has not obtained approval and entered into a binding lease or purchase agreement for each site for El Pollo Loco® Restaurant(s) to be developed under this Agreement by the applicable Site Commitment Date, Developer shall be in default of its obligations under the Development Schedule, however Franchisor will provide an automatic 60-day extension without penalty to allow Developer additional time to finalize agreements, and termination of this Agreement is not an available remedy for missing the initial Site Commitment Date.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a direct contradiction by stating that while time is of the essence and missing the Site Commitment Date constitutes a default, the Franchisor provides an automatic 60 day extension and termination is not a remedy. This contradicts the original text where missing the deadline immediately triggers default and allows for termination, thus creating uncertainty about the consequences of failing to meet the initial deadline.

perturbation.original_text: 10.1. This Agreement shall terminate immediately upon El Pollo Loco's receipt of Developer's notice to terminate. In such event, the Development Fee shall be forfeited to Franchisor in consideration of the rights granted in the Territory up to the time of termination. Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary contained herein, unless earlier terminated by either party, this Agreement shall expire on ______, 20___, and all rights of Developer herein shall cease and all unapplied or unused Development Fees paid pursuant to Section 3 hereof shall be forfeited to Franchisor.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1. This Agreement shall terminate immediately upon El Pollo Loco's receipt of Developer's notice to terminate. In such event, 50% of the Development Fee shall be returned to the Developer in consideration of the rights granted in the Territory up to the time of termination. Notwithstanding any provision to the contrary contained herein, unless earlier terminated by either party, this Agreement shall expire on ______, 20___, and all rights of Developer herein shall cease, and all unapplied or unused Development Fees paid pursuant to Section 3 hereof shall be refunded to Franchisor. The Franchisor is required to allocate unapplied or unused development fees to the Developer upon the end of the contract.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation creates an in-text contradiction by first stating the Development Fee is forfeited to Franchisor upon termination by the Developer, but then later indicating that the unapplied or unused Development Fees shall be refunded to the developer. This creates uncertainty and inconsistency. On top of this 50% of the Development Fee shall be returned to the Developer in consideration of the rights granted in the Territory up to the time of termination.

perturbation.original_text:
16.1. Initial Meeting and Mediation - Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, before any legal action is filed involving any claim or controversy between Franchisor and Developer (including its affiliates, investors, and Owners) relating to (a) this Agreement, (b) the parties business activities conducted as a result of this Agreement, or (c) the parties’ relationship or business dealings with each other generally, the following procedure shall be complied with:
a. The party wishing to resolve a dispute shall initiate negotiation proceedings by first requesting in writing a meeting with the other party or parties. Within forty-five (45) days of receipt of the initial request for a meeting, the parties shall meet within the county in which Developer is then located, to discuss and negotiate toward a resolution of the controversy.
b. If negotiation efforts do not succeed, the parties shall engage in mandatory but non-binding mediation by a mediator jointly chosen by the parties or if the parties cannot agree upon a mediator, appointed by, and in accordance with the procedures of, JAMS or, if JAMS is no longer in existence, an organization of similar quality
c. A mediation meeting will be held at a place and at a time mutually agreeable to the parties and the mediator. The Mediator will determine and control the format and procedural aspects of the mediation meeting which will be designed to ensure that both the mediator and the parties have an opportunity to present and hear an oral presentation of each party’s views regarding the matter in controversy. The parties act in good faith to resolve the controversy in mediation.
d. The mediation will be held as soon as practicable after the negotiation meeting is held. The mediator will be free to meet and communicate separately with each party either before, during or after the mediation meeting within 60 days of demand by either party.
perturbation.changed_text:
16.1. Initial Meeting and Mediation - Except as otherwise provided in this Agreement, before any legal action is filed involving any claim or controversy between Franchisor and Developer (including its affiliates, investors, and Owners) relating to (a) this Agreement, (b) the parties business activities conducted as a result of this Agreement, or (c) the parties’ relationship or business dealings with each other generally, the following procedure shall be complied with:
a. The party wishing to resolve a dispute shall initiate negotiation proceedings by first requesting in writing a meeting with the other party or parties. The dispute must be resolved within one week. 
b. If negotiation efforts do not succeed, the parties shall engage in mandatory but non-binding arbitration by a mediator jointly chosen by the parties or if the parties cannot agree upon a mediator, appointed by, and in accordance with the procedures of, JAMS or, if JAMS is no longer in existence, an organization of similar quality. The Arbitration decisions are binding.
c. A mediation meeting will be held at a place selected by the Franchisor. The Mediator will control the format and procedural aspects of the mediation meeting.
d. The mediation will be held prior to the negotiation meeting. The mediator will be free to only meet with the Franchisor.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces several contradictions. Firstly, the original text specifies a 45-day period for the initial meeting after a written request, while the changed text says the dispute must be resolved in one week. Secondly, the original text mandates non-binding mediation, while the changed text specifies binding arbitration. Thirdly, the original text states the mediation meeting place is mutually agreeable, while the changed text says it will be selected by the Franchisor. Lastly, the original text allows the mediator to meet with both parties, while the changed text limits meetings to only the Franchisor, creating uncertainty.
